name: USA Sports in a Pot Quiz | USA | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the PDC World Dart Championships, the games consist of winning a certain amount of legs to win a set.  How many legs are required to win one set?
questions.explanation:
3.

	3 legs are in a set, therefore, the finals are often requiring the first player to 10 sets to win.  This would need the player to win 30 legs.

questions.text: What veteran kicker, and former Denver Bronco great, led the Atlanta Falcons in scoring for 2008?
questions.explanation:
Jason Elam.

	The former Bronco led the Falcons with 129 points as he made 29 field goals and 42 extra points.

questions.text: Who did the Red Wings trade to get Igor Larionov in 2000?
questions.explanation:
Yan Golubovsky.

	The Red Wings first got Larionov in 1995 for Ray Shepard from San Jose.  In 2000, he came back to the Wings for Golubovsky from Florida.  He won three Cups with the Wings in 1997, 1998, and 2001.

questions.text: What was the Detroit Red Wings season record for the 2007-08 season?
questions.explanation:
54-21-7.

	The Detroit Red Wings won the Stanley Cup in the 2007-08 season. They beat the Pittsburgh Penguins.

questions.text: Major League Baseball Pittsburgh Pirate Jason Bay was the first Pirate to win what award?
questions.explanation:
Rookie of the Year.

	Jason Bay won the award in 2004. No other Pirate before him had won it. Catcher Jason Kendall was the closest when he finished 3rd in voting in his 1996 rookie season.

questions.text: Where is the University of Florida football campus located?
questions.explanation:
Gainesville.

	The Gators' stadium is nicknamed "The Swamp".  In 2008, the Gators won five crowns in the SEC for women's sports.  They were golf, soccer, softball, tennis, and volleyball.

questions.text: What year was the NHLs Pittsburgh Penguins franchise founded?
questions.explanation:
1967.

	When the NHL doubled in size for the start of 1967-68, Pittsburgh was one of six cities awarded an expansion team.

questions.text: 2008 New York Jets wide receiver Brad Smith attended which school in college?
questions.explanation:
Missouri.

	Smith played mainly quarterback for the Memphis Tigers, but was converted to wide receiver in the NFL.

questions.text: Who set a Major League Baseball record for most career doubles?
questions.explanation:
Tris Speaker.

	Tris Speaker was one of the most underrated players of all-time.  He played most of his career with the Red Sox and Indians, and retired in 1928 with 792 doubles.  He was a Hall of Fame inductee in 1937.

questions.text: Which Big Ten college hockey coach played for the Detroit Red Wings?
questions.explanation:
Red Berenson.

	Red played from 1971-1975 for the Wings.  He was later head coach for the University of Michigan ice hockey program.
